name: recumbent
content:
recumbent adjective
(LYING DOWN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
literary lying down or leaning back so you are almost lying down: She looked at Timothy's recumbent form beside her. I found him seated in a recumbent position on the bank.
More examplesFewer examplesShe dug her toes in the sheets, before assuming a recumbent posture.On the sides of the tomb bearing the recumbent statue of the duke are carved 41 figures.Each advert shows a different teenager, recumbent on a sofa.

recumbent adjective
(WITH BACK SUPPORT)
used to refer to a type of bicycle that has a part at the back that you can lean back on when riding: She's walking now, and riding a recumbent exercise bike. Reclined recumbent cycles can help alleviate some of the aches and pains associated with recreational riding.
More examplesFewer examplesMost people in the U. S. have never heard of a recumbent trike.There are several types of stationary bikes, including upright bikes that tend to flex the core muscles and recumbent bikes that provide more back support.I'm looking forward to the days when my partner is up to front seating the recumbent tandem and I can knit and ride.
